poem:
### The Deal

After long shadows and the talk of men,  
An ink-stained promise straddles  
Two distant lands, each holding  
An edge of the paper.  
What is gained, folded into silence,  
Will press against the future's palm;  
An economy crafted by those  
Who barter in dreams, sewn  
Into the seams of another  
Uneven dawn.
